snippet: The world’s biggest song publisher has threatened to end its relationship with the music licensing agencies Ascap and BMI if those groups do not agree to its demands.
abstract: World's largest song publisher Sony/ATV is threatening to end its relationship with music licensing agencies Ascap and BMI if those groups do not agree to changes in decades-old regulatory agreements; announcement comes as music publishing world ponders major structural changes in response to rise of online streaming services, which critics say pay too little in royalties.
lead_paragraph: The world’s biggest song publisher has threatened to end its relationship with the music licensing agencies Ascap and BMI if those groups do not agree to its demands.

headline.main: Sony Threatens to Bypass Licensers in Royalties Battle
headline.print_headline: Sony Threatens to Bypass Licensers in Royalties Battle

keywords.value: American Society of Composers, Authors and Publishers
keywords.name: organizations
